description_txt: stated on April 15, 2011 in a speech:
quote_txt: If we had the same staffing ratio (of officers to residents) as Seattle, we'd have 300 more officers in our department."

description_txt: stated on April 14, 2011 in a speech in the House of Representatives:
quote_txt: "For every 33 pregnant women that walk into a Planned Parenthood clinic, 32 receive an abortion."

description_txt: stated on April 15, 2011 in an episode of HBO's "Real Time with Bill Maher":
quote_txt: Under a proposal by Rep. Paul Ryan, people on Medicare will only have $15,000 from the federal government to spend on their health care.

description_txt: stated on April 18, 2011 in a Web ad:
quote_txt: "Seniors will have to find $12,500 for health care because Republicans voted to end Medicare."

description_txt: stated on April 20, 2011 in comments published in the 'St. Petersburg Times':
quote_txt: An Internet sweepstakes cafe is "a legitimate business that has been vetted and found to be completely legal in the state."

description_txt: stated on April 15, 2011 in comments made on the House floor.:
quote_txt: "The facts show that approximately 40 persons on death row have had all of their appellate review completed and await only the governor's signature on a death warrant to end the case."

description_txt: stated on April 6, 2011 in a radio interview:
quote_txt: General Electric "hasn't really created any jobs in this country, doesn't  pay any taxes, and they're making historic profits."

description_txt: stated on April 13, 2011 in a Twitter post:
quote_txt: "America's wealthiest 25 percent pay 86 percent of total income taxes. Wealthiest 5 percent pay 60 percent of total income taxes."

description_txt: stated on April 15, 2011 in an interview on MSNBC's "The Rachel Maddow Show":
quote_txt: According to David Cay Johnston, "the average American pays about 22 percent of their income to federal taxes. The richest 400 Americans … pay about 16 percent of their income to federal taxes."

description_txt: stated on April 17, 2011 in an interview on "This Week with Christiane Amanpour":
quote_txt: "Every time we've cut taxes, revenues have gone up, the economy has grown."

description_txt: stated on March 31, 2011 in a Twitter post.:
quote_txt: "[Appalachian Power] wants another 10 percent rate increase. The compensation package for CEO Mike Morris rose 22 percent to $8.7 million in 2010."

description_txt: stated on March 31, 2011 in an interview on Fox News:
quote_txt: "In this bill that I’ve just signed, we don’t cut anybody’s salary. We don’t take away their pension. And we don’t destroy their health care."

description_txt: stated on April 6, 2011 in a political ad:
quote_txt: (Dennis) Richardson wants to make drastic cuts to services we depend on: schools, home care for seniors, even public safety -- all so Richardson can keep more than $440 million in unspent funds for his political priorities."

description_txt: stated on March 18, 2011 in a letter.:
quote_txt: Says the fluoride Austin is putting in its drinking water is "toxic waste."

description_txt: stated on April 12, 2011 in a speech before Congress:
quote_txt: Says President Franklin Delano Roosevelt sent his advisers to study socialism with Soviet dictator Josef Stalin so the president could replicate it in the United States.

description_txt: stated on April 13, 2011 in a speech at George Washington University:
quote_txt: The Republican budget plan "says that 10 years from now, if you’re a 65-year-old who’s eligible for Medicare, you should have to pay nearly $6,400 more than you would today."

description_txt: stated on April 13, 2011 in an interview on NBC's "Today" show:
quote_txt: "The top 1 percent of income-earners pay about 40 percent of all taxes into the federal government."

description_txt: stated on April 14, 2011 in a fundraising e-mail:
quote_txt: "Americans will pay more in taxes in 2011 than they will spend on groceries, clothing and shelter combined."

description_txt: stated on April 14, 2011 in testimony before Congress.:
quote_txt: "Hackers broke into Virginia's prescription-drug database (and) ... obtained more than 8.2 million patient records and a total of nearly 36 million prescriptions."

description_txt: stated on April 4, 2011 in a TV interview, as well as other venues:
quote_txt: Milwaukee is "the most segregated city in America."

description_txt: stated on April 3, 2011 in House floor remarks:
quote_txt: "The costs of cancer and all affiliated issues are over $20 billion a year to this state."

description_txt: stated on April 4, 2011 in a newspaper article:
quote_txt: "If you go strictly by the numbers, crime is down across the board. Last year we had a 10 percent decrease in the most serious crimes."

description_txt: stated on February 10, 2011 in a speech in the House of Representatives:
quote_txt: "What we have done with the PATRIOT Act, we've given the government enormous powers. We've given the government the right to reach deeply into people's private lives, into their business affairs, without a court order."

description_txt: stated on April 7, 2011 in remarks at a news conference:
quote_txt: Human error, such as skipping a community in the Wisconsin Supreme Court race, "is common in (the vote-tabulation) process.

description_txt: stated on April 5, 2011 in a Providence Journal story:
quote_txt: "Full marriage equality [would provide same-sex couples] with about 1,700 rights."

quote_txt: Multnomah County has faced "11 straight years" of cuts

description_txt: stated on April 4, 2011 in House floor debate.:

description_txt: stated on April 15, 2011 in comments on 'Fox and Friends':
